step.context: \text{For a function }f(x)\text{ to be continuous}\\ \text{at }x = a,\text{ what must be true?}
step.reason: \text{If a function is continuous at }x =a,\text{ then}\\ \text{it can be drawn through }x=a\text{ without lifting}\\ \text{the pencil. But if }\lim_{x\to a^-}f(x)\neq\lim_{x\to a^+}f(x)\\ \text{ or }\lim_{x\to a}f(x)\neq f(a), \text{ then the pencil will}\\ \text{have to be lifted}\implies \text{discontinuity.}

step.context: \text{Is the following true for }f(x) = x^n\\ \text{at }x=n, n\in\mathbb{Z}^+?
step.tex: \begin{align} \lim_{x\to n^-}x^n &= n^n \\ \lim_{x\to n^+}x^n &= n^n \\ f(n) &= n^n\\ \end{align}\\ \text{And therefore, }f(x) = x^n\text{ is continous}\\ \text{at }x=n, n\in\mathbb{Z}^+.
